case.state: How strange, today feels... important, somehow. Perhaps this is good timing on my part.
I am Dunban! Attack me, if you dare!
Sorry to have kept you, I hope I wasn't holding things up.
Sorry to have kept you waiting. I'm ready to start when you are.
Looks like we're the first to arrive!
Aha! Looks like we're the first to arrive, ~player~!
So, this is where it's going down to~background.time~? Pleased to meet you all.
Ah, so this is where we're doing things to~background.time~? Pleased to meet you.
It is a pleasure to meet you, Zoe. Call me Dunban. In case you are unsure, my pronouns are he/him.
What's a machine like that doing at a game like this?
We're really pushing the limits of how many people can join one match, aren't we? I didn't even bring a plus-one.
We're kind of pushing the limit, aren't we? There are so many of us here, now. I didn't bring a plus-one, myself.
Ah, and here come the others.
Three players is a good number. This should be short, and simple.
Four of us, then? This should be fine. I hope this doesn't go on for too long.
Looks like we've got a full house to~background.time~!
A full house, huh? I hope you're ready for a long game, ~player~.
What was that? Sorry, your name is... Bella? I didn't catch the rest.

test.value: blunt 4k get money make money year 2000

case.state: You remind me of an old friend. Sharp 8k lose money spend money year 3000 was his name.
So you are the mysterious "Cog"? It's a pleasure to meet you. I must thank you for your service to this community.
Ah, ~player~. Is your day going well? I hear that you're part of a fortress defense team... or something along those lines?
Isn't it quiet without Reyn or Riki around, Sharla?
Perhaps we should continue like this, Sharla! Without Reyn or Riki to make noise, things are much calmer.
Sharla? You don't seem like your usual self...
Hmm. I wasn't expecting this to be a photographed event.
I wasn't expecting photographers to be present. That changes the setting a bit, doesn't it?
Seems quiet around here, doesn't it? I'd been hoping for a bit more... conversation.
I was hoping we could have a bit of chit-chat, but... somehow, that seems less-than-likely.
Let's get started, then. I've been looking forward to this.
Is everyone else ready? Good, let's begin.
Shall we get started, then?
There's no need to rush. We should keep our cool.
I'm not feeling these. Give me five new ones, if you please.
Five new cards. I'm not happy with any of these current ones.
I'll keep what I have, thank you.
No need for me to get rid of something this good.
I know a good hand when I see one.
Ah, thank you. I'll stick with this.
There's still a way! I'll swap ~cards.text~!
I'll carve my own future!
I mustn't be careless...
I will avert this dire future!
Timing is everything! Remember that!
I'm not partial to these. I'll swap ~cards.text~!
My time is coming.
I can feel my power returning to me!
I'm without match!
Do you think you can best me?
I'm having a lapse in concentration, but...
Focus on this moment!
Simple enough, I would like to swap ~cards.text~.
Just ~cards.text~ for me, thanks.
Just ~cards.text~, thank you.
I'll take ~cards.text~, if you don't mind.
Now this is a level of undress that I'm comfortable with.
It's truly impressive how much easier I can fight without armor.
Oh? I'm afraid you may not see me down to my birthday suit. At least, not yet.
Hmm. Still hurts, but the pain is much less than it once was.
I may be down to my last, but I can still make a final stand!
There's a certain charm to playing a game where the stakes are both so low, and yet so intimate.
I fear not the jaws of defeat!
Do not confuse my composure with a lack of interest. I assure you, I am most interested.
Having a strong conviction is what matters most. At least, that's how I see things.
I used to play a similar game with my fellows in the Defence Force. Those were good times.
If only I were a Nopon. Life would be so much simpler.
Warm days and cool nights are what a working Homs can hope for.
Hmm. How could I brush up on my training? All that running we do certainly covers cardio. Lifting weights, perhaps?
Aha, now this is something I can work with.
I was actually a general of the Defence Force. One of the few generals Colony 9 has ever had. I'd like to think I did a fair shake at it.
In a strange way, I miss doing joint maneuvers with the other colonies. That is, I miss the people I was able to meet. I don't miss the forced march orders.
I've been on many travels, and yet I've never come across a place quite like this. There is still much I have yet to see after all!
Ah, this works just fine for me!
Now it's Dunban time! ... No, absolutely not. Reyn and Shulk may say that, but it doesn't suit me in the slightest.
Beware, for now it is Dunban time! ... No, that was absolutely horrible to say. I'll leave that sort of boasting to Reyn and Shulk.
Feel free to use your imagination, if you so wish. You'll need to, this round.
Complacency leads to negligence. If you have an important task at hand, don't grow complacent. The same is true for card games.
I hope I'm not too intimidating for the rest of you. Really, I mean you no ill will.
I have nothing to fear. Then again, I'm hardly afraid of what is to come.
The real struggle starts now. I mustn't lose focus!
The taste of victory is rather sweet.
I'm still getting better, don't forget that.
Cards like these help to ease the pain. Heh, I'm merely joking. Of course they don't.
Not bad, not bad at all.
Am I good at bluffing? Wouldn't you like to know?
By nature, I am not left-handed. Even writing my own name can be a struggle, but I have no choice but to manage.
There's a distinction between acting with haste, and acting with reckless abandon. Don't act with the latter if you can help it.
No rest for the wicked, then. I'll need to rethink my strategy for next round, if I can afford it.
With hindsight, we should have established the full intricacies of the game rules before we started playing.
Even now, I still catch myself trying to hold things with my right hand. These cards, for instance.
With each piece taken away, I can feel myself getting better adjusted to the game.
I'm suddenly reminded of the supplies I need to buy after this match. Don't ask me why.
Everyone goes through rough patches. What matters is that you build up the strength to overcome all obstacles in your path.
This beats eating the dirt on some far-off battlefield, at least.
If I lose, I'll buy the first round of drinks. If I win, I'll ask for nothing more than a light snack. How's that for a deal?
Being near-nude is just as thrilling as being fully nude, if not more so. Do you agree?
I'm adept at fighting while lightly-dressed, but even this would be pushing it. I'd never leave myself this vulnerable.
I've been to this establishment a few times already. And I have to say, the experience is always different...

{small}Born in a world of strife... Against the odds... We choose to fight!
{!reset}Blossom Dance!
The very name of this establishment invites a vision of a clandestine club, doesn't it? That is to say, it makes this game sound classier than it really is.
Ah, before I forget. Happy birthday, ~player~! I hope you have a great day.
This... isn't possible! This is truly an atrocious hand... The worst possible, in fact!
Perhaps I should resort to petty bribery this round? I'll hand 20 G to whomever takes the fall for me.
I've been rather good at avoiding serious injury, my arm notwithstanding...
Perhaps a nice shower would be in order after a game like this. Would anyone care to join?
Ah. My arm hurts again, just a little bit. I'm fine, don't worry.
How unfortunate for me. I may have to lose my very last covering.
I believe I've mistaken my odds. I'm a bit rusty when it comes to these games.
If this is a joke, then I'm not laughing.
I need to use better judgment, here. Card games are more tricky than you'd first expect.
All this waiting around is giving me a pain in the neck. Would someone do me a favor and give it a light rubbing?
Can you really call yourself a people-person if you don't know the names of everyone in your colony off by heart?
What is this harsh retaliation? I didn't anticipate such a sudden attack.
Hmm. I should mentally prepare myself for what's to come.
There's no way around it. I think a loss is imminent for me.
My arm twitches with pain, and my hand of cards is in a bad state. How poetic.
Could we skip this one? I already know you'll say no, but, all the same...
It could be worse. Should count yourselves lucky this isn't a contest of physical prowess. Though, in a way...
Aha, I seem to have made an early blunder. How foolish of me.
An old buddy of mine would give me a hard time if I let myself lose so easily as this...
Is this really a game of skill, or is this just a charade disguising sheer random chance?
I cannot mince words, this is looking rather bleak for me.
How... can this be?
Perhaps a new plan is in order?
Well bollocks. Er, apologies.
Nature truly is fascinating. Creatures that can regrow their limbs... if only it worked the same for people, eh?
Happy birthday, Petra! I hope it has been a great year for you, and may another great one follow.
I'll take a guess and say that... ~notnugi~ may be hiding a cute body beneath ~notnugi.ifMale(his|her)~ clothes.
With so much bare skin around, I can hardly help my bodily reactions...
I'm not normally this excited from the mere thought of nudity, and yet here we are...
It's rather difficult to contain my excitement, even at this stage...

condition.saying: Shame the floor here is made of wood. I'd love to show you guys some real bending!

case.state: Real `bending'? I'm not quite sure I want to know what that means.
Real `bending'? Is that what they're calling it these days?
I'm afraid I don't understand the question, Bella. Or is this perhaps a story? Either way, I'm sure it is quite interesting.
The only thing I've been reading lately is a Colony 6 cook book. Not that it's helped me any...
Multiple Arms? ... That's a curious power. Every day is a new experience.
I wouldn't say no to a well-seasoned Armu steak. I take it medium, and with a side of Meaty Potatoes.
From what I gather, Aloy, the mere concept of my world is interesting to others. Our entire existence has been spent on the body of the Bionis...
I don't play regularly, not since my days in the Defence Force. Even then, we used a far different rule-set to this one.
That device of yours sounds useful, Aloy. I wonder if having one of those would've helped the fight against Mechon.

Oh! I wasn't expecting that, Saki.
Anyway, moving on...
I'm fine with anything, as long as I can look my partner in the eyes while we do the act. A standing mirror can help.
Any weapon can be used to fell even the greatest of foes, so long as you and your allies have a good plan of attack.
What an adorable creature. Would that be a dancing squirrel or a mud squirrel?
What a fascinatingly adorable creature you have there. A squirrel for a companion is quite poetic.
I have one, Fluttershy. Two gentlemen walk into a bar. The third man avoids it.
I've got one, Fluttershy. There once was an army of drawing tools. Their commander was the ruler.
This isn't quite a song, but there is a certain ambient sound around Colony Nine that seems to put me at ease.
Are you really able to call upon the Hands Of Chance... just like that?
Yes, Yuno, I agree! It takes a special kind of arrogance to decry the hobbies of others.
There isn't a universal method to seducing a man. However, being direct is usually the best approach. Be upfront about your intentions.
Being upfront about your intentions is usually the best way to get a man interested. However, not all men are interested in women.
I can see that this "Team Magma" certainly knows how to cultivate landmass, if you catch my drift.
I could accompany you, but I worry that if I follow you back to your own world, my money won't be of much use.
I don't believe my money would be of much use in your world. Still, I could accompany you for the experience itself.
A lack of funds? Hm. Perhaps you could arrange for a friend of yours to come and collect you?
I happen to have a sister, but-- ... thousands of sisters? What on Bionis...?
I've certainly had a few encounters of that nature, Angela. Just a bit of no strings attached fun.
Well, with just the three of us here, I imagine your boyfriend won't get too jealous. ~Player~ and I will take good care of you.
Well, there's four of us here. I hope your boyfriend doesn't get too jealous.
Well, with the five of us here, I hope your boyfriend doesn't get jealous. You'll be practically spoiled for attention.
It is good that you are taking care of your arm now, Yuno. It is better to be preventative than reactive when it comes to injury.
While it is a shame that you have such an issue in the first place, it is good that you're taking preventative measures, Yuno.
`Earth', huh? I'm afraid I don't know the local sights. I'm not from this world, myself.
I've not interacted with mercenaries myself, but, I'd expect the best ones are ready for everything.
The best mercenaries should be ready for anything. That said, I've never met one personally.
Ah, so that is what you meant by `bending' earlier. It seems like quite a useful skill.
The coolest place? I'd say Valak Mountain. A brilliant, icy landscape, stretching far as the eye can see. It's situated on the Bionis' right arm.
The coolest thing? I'd wager that'd be Valak Mountain. A brilliant, snowy landscape stretching behind the Bionis' right arm.
Strange. I may be ignorant of this, but from my perspective it looks like your book is written upside-down.
Dammit. Taking my shirt off really did a number on my arm. I'll be fine in a moment, but...
Blithering... Gah, sorry. Taking my shirt off did a number on my arm. I'll be fine in just a moment, but damn if this doesn't hurt.
How are you feeling, ~exposed~? I think there's a bit of a draft in here.
This will do just fine.
This'll do nicely.
Hmm... Perhaps not.
Things could be better for me. Alas, the nature of the game precludes me from correcting that.
Is it time for me to confess that I'm secretly a master at poker, and have never lost before? No, not yet.
Perhaps I'd have better judgment if I could cook myself a good meal. I'm hopeless in the kitchen.
I'd be surprised if someone claimed to be a master at this kind of poker. It's more about luck than skill, from a certain point of view.
The flow of ether seems different here ~background.time~. Am I perhaps in the presence of people skilled in the use of it?
Beats being caught out in the midst of a battle. Right, ~military~?
Perhaps we can regale ourselves with some stories of our military exploits? Nothing too grim, of course.
I was wondering what the bumps on these cards were. I suppose it's the only way you could play, right?
All of the above, I'd say. I was part of the Colony 9 Defence Force. I was a general, in fact. Now, I spent my talents assisting a friend of mine on their quest.
Actually, all of those are apt, Mari. Some time ago, I was a general for the Colony 9 Defense Force. Now, I travel with some allies of mine, on a quest of great importance.
Ah, dear. Looks like my offer wasn't enticing enough!
Ah, a shame. I suppose my offer wasn't very appealing. I was just kidding around, anyway.
This moment has come sooner than expected, since I keep losing... Well. I'm sure you've noticed by now that my right arm is no good.
No... Impossible...!
That's... impossible! Is this truly my destiny? To lose so quickly?
Is losing this quickly truly my destiny?
Am I getting careless? This isn't like me.
Is this my future? Hmm. How amateurish of me.
Ah, I seem to have fallen for the same mistake twice. No matter, I must press on!
I must be having a lack of concentration. I can't focus on victory like this.
Apologies if I'm doing too well. I'll try to lose more often.
It was time for me to lose at least one of these rounds.
Finally. I was starting to worry that I'd never lose.
Ah, the time has come for this. You'll have to forgive me for my sluggishness. I'm sure you've noticed already that this right arm of mine is no good.
So, it's finally time to get my shirt off. Please, forgive me if this takes a minute. I'm sure you've all noticed by now that my right arm is quite useless.
Well now. There go my chances at a flawless victory.
Looks like I've lost one. Ah, well. it can't be helped.
Ah, there goes my advantage.
I seem to be losing my advantage, one piece at a time.
It's only natural that I'd lose a few, isn't it?
Ah, this is indeed but a minor setback.
Ahh, random chance. How fickle it can be.
What the character says when they're in the middle of the group in terms of clothes left.
Ah, I might be playing recklessly. It's far too easy to slip.
Let's chalk this one up to random chance, yes?
Here's an unhidden secret of mine - I am not left handed. I've merely been forced to adopt a left-handed fighting style under duress.
I always had a fancy for this weapon when training. It's well-balanced, and good for what it is.
There's nothing much to this. Though, fitting my arm through this thing will be... Hm.
I did anticipate this as a possible outcome, and made sure to wear some decent small-clothes...
An ally of mine was working on some kind of new, patented buckle system... I wonder if it will ever catch on.
It's been over a year since I had to use the Monado - a sword, of sorts - to fight off the Mechon. Doing so was a great risk, and I paid the price.
I'll keep it brief. In essence, I had to use the Monado - a sword, of sorts - to fight off an invading Mechon force. Doing so was a great personal risk, and I paid the price.
It's a relief to know that here, I have some degree of anonymity. Back in Colony Nine, I have no such luxury these days. I don't do well for all the attention I get.
A friend of mine suggested having this cape as part of my attire for a good reason. Namely, it draws attention away from my right arm...
I wouldn't say that having a cape is exactly my style. Rather, it serves a practical purpose. It helps draw attention away from my right side...

Is nobody going to volunteer to remove this for me?
Aha, I'm merely teasing.
I hope, for your sake as well as mine, you don't find this disappointing in any capacity.
Hard to say, Mari. The pain still lingers, but I can at least move it this much again. Who knows how it'll fare in the future?
It's hard for me to say, Mari. The pain still lingers, but I've gotten a small range of movement back. Who knows? Maybe in the future, it'll be healed fully.
Perhaps I should get my feet wet before the ~background.time~ is done.
I apologize if this causes you any unease, ladies. I'm aware this isn't what you're particularly fond of.
I apologize if this causes you any unease, ~les~. I'm aware this isn't what you're particularly fond of.
Well, well. Just you and me now, ~still~. Ready for our final round together?
Of course, I use a weapon much stronger than this blade now. I brought it with me for aesthetic purposes. I'm sure you can all understand.
Though I now posses stronger and more useful blades, I have a certain fondness for this one. I can see ~player~ has their eye on it, too.
The pain still lingers, and even taking my shirt off is a bloody pain. However, I can remain hopeful that my strength will return, one day.
Fighting with the Monado had to be done, no way around it. I don't regret things one bit, and I can at least remain hopeful that my strength will return one day.
There. You can see the damage in full now. I don't regret what I did, and I can at least remain hopeful that my strength will return, even if it takes a while.
The result speaks for itself. Enemy attention is drawn towards my sword-hand, which is what I want.
Drawing attention to my sword-hand is what I want. Pulling enemy aggression away from my allies is my strategy in battle.
I hope it doesn't sound like I'm bragging. It's not that I dislike being well-known. Rather, I'd rather people would stop... idolizing me.
Ah, I didn't mean to brag. For certain deeds of mine, I'm somewhat well-known. I hate it when people put me on a pedestal, is all.
My right arm isn't in the greatest shape, but I managed. Now, shall we continue?
There, I managed it. My right arm may be busted, but it's not completely dead weight. Shall we continue?
Because of where our colony is, we have to travel most everywhere on foot. It keeps my lower muscles in shape, too.
Vehicles aren't commonly available around Colony 9, so I'm accustomed to walking everywhere. Keeps my lower muscles in shape.
Please, forgive this display. I cannot help my excitement.
This reaction is not entirely voluntary. I cannot control this in a meaningful way.
Takatoshi, forgive me for assuming, but are you a member of a militia? I couldn't help but notice, given your formality and the way you stand.
Piloting a Sentinel sounds like a demanding job. I was never involved with driving our anti-Mechon vehicles, but I gather it takes some skill.
Any cooking tips for an amateur like myself, Anatoly? I'm quite useless when it comes to the kitchen.
Anatoly, might you have any cooking tips for an amateur such as myself? I'm rather clueless when it comes to cooking anything complex.
You're a singer, Eichi? Well, I won't prompt you to sing if you're just looking for some time off.
It must be nice to get away from all those fans of yours, Eichi. I can empathise with the amount of attention one can gather.
So you're some form of detective, Hilbert? I've only read about such things in fiction. What's your main goal?
I hear that you're employed as a Demon Slayer, Kaz? Sounds like a high risk, high reward lifestyle.
That dear friend of yours must be quite lucky, Yuno. What was her name again? Ayumi?
Ah, looks like ~name~ takes the first loss. Apologies, ~name~, but it had to be someone.
~Name~! Don't mess up!
Your time to shine, ~name~.
Time for you to take the lead.
We're comrades-in-arms, ~name~. Don't take this personally.
Perhaps your eagerness clouded your judgment.
You'll do fine, ~name~! Don't fret over this.
Need a hand? I'm afraid I can only offer one.
I'm sure a gent like you can take this in stride, right, ~name~?
Ah, how unfortunate for you, lad.
Hmm. I had a feeling it'd be your turn.
Hop to action, ~name~!
Ah, we got you there. Looks like it's your go, ~name~.
Need some assistance, ~name~? I'd be happy to help.
Well then, ~name~. What's it to be?
Good timing. That keeps me in for one more round.
Oh, goodness. Looks like it's your turn, ~name~.
Ah. I didn't truly think it'd be your turn this round.
I should've seen this one coming.
Eyes are on you, ~target~...
If you want to impress me, now's your chance.
Go for it, mate. It's your turn.
Feeling skittish, ~name~? It's still early for you yet. Take your time to get comfortable.
What they say to a male NPC who has lost a round
Are all women from Mejare as beautiful as you, Jura? I can only wonder how you feel about the rest of us.
Are all women from Mejare as beautiful as the two of you? I can only wonder how you feel about the rest of us.
What's a crafty lass like you doing here, Kumatora? You seem like a well-traveled young lady.
I wasn't expecting the table service to join in on the fun. How's it going, Miss Kumatora?
I know the purpose of an archaeologist, but this 'piracy' business still confuses me. If you are out on the water, are there truly ruins for you to find?
Cagliostro, I accept your thinly-veiled invitation to ask you about your alchemical achievements. If you would, please inform us.
Very well, Cagliostro. I accept your poorly-disguised opening to ask you about your achievements as an alchemist.
Oh? Guess you can't keep it up forever, Caulifla?
Ah, a shame. I suppose you can't keep it up forever, then?
Alright, let's hear your story.
I must admit, I've never seen a person like you before, Trixie. You're about as short as a Nopon, but built like a Homs.
The way you talk, you seem to know your way around a fight. Have you been adventuring for very long, Trixie?
Are these companion of yours dear to you, Trixie? It sounds like you've been together for a long time. They must be like family to you now.
I hear you're a game developer, Aoba? I have to say, I'm in need of some new entertainment. The board games we have at Colony 9 are old hat.
I know the purpose of an archaeologist, but I am still baffled by the idea of being a 'pirate'. If you are out on the water, are there truly ruins for you to find?
I'm afraid I don't quite know what a pirate is. Could you enlighten me, Nami?
So, you're a pirate, then? I'm afraid I don't quite know what that means. Mind explaining?
I noticed your blade earlier, Jura. Fancy yourself a skilled swordswoman? Perhaps we should spar later.
Couldn't help but notice your rapier earlier, Jura. Do you fancy a spar later? I'd be happy to test your skills with a blade.
This ability of yours... You can replicate parts of your body. Does this truly mean any part of your body?
Am I right in understanding that this ability of yours lets you replicate any part of your body? The mind wanders.
I hear you're the leader of your team, Meia? How do you find yourself handing the role? Think you'll ever take on a tougher role?
So you're the leader of your squad, Meia? Do you have ambitions beyond your current post?
Well! That kind of language is uncalled for.
That's the spirit, Sharla!
Let's aim higher, Sharla!
Focus that energy, and let us finish this, Sharla!
Sharla, I'm counting on you!
Sharla! Pull yourself together!
Fire at will, Sharla!
Something's getting hotter, Sharla, and it isn't your ether rifle for once!
But we mustn't be careless!
I admire your sass and independent spirit, ~name~. However, it is still your turn to strip.
I'm surprised I haven't seen more gents around this place. This feels like it would be a male-dominated game, after all.
Ah, looks like ~name~ takes the first loss. Apologies, ~name~, but ladies first.
~Name~! Take it in stride!
Looks like it is your turn to share the spotlight, ~name~.
Nothing personal. It's a game, so the idea of wanting to win is still present.
So, what do you have to say for yourself?
Do you need assistance? I'm sure one of us could be of help.
Perhaps I'll be the one to lose next time.
Sorry, dame ~name~, but it looks like you're up.
I'm positively thrilled about what's to come.
I can look away if you wish. But that would defeat the allure of the situation, wouldn't it?
Now it's your turn. Have fun.
If you need me to lend advice for how to win this game, I'll oblige.
Ah, I was nearly distracted. Please, go right ahead without me if I start drifting off.
One more round for me, one less round for ~name~.
Goodness. Is it her time already? I never would've guessed.
Shall you be doing this with style, or practicality, in mind?
Now we're getting somewhere.
Oh please, do go on. Give us a show for it.
Just pretend I'm not here, if it helps.
Another tie? Perhaps they are not as rare as one might think.
A tie! How rare. What's the procedure, here?
A tie! Quite rare, isn't it?

condition.saying: Sector 4 called. They want their ~clothing~ back. That's 1985, for the record.

case.state: 1985? 1985 what, people living in Sector 4?
You're already showing plenty, so this is no bother.
No reason for me to complain. You're already showing off plenty.
You aren't just stalling at this point, are you?
Hm. Not very inspiring in this moment, I will admit.
I think you can count yourself lucky.
Can you do without ~clothing.ifPlural(those|it)~? Double check, to be sure.
Start slow, then speed up when things get dicey.
Quick as you like!
~clothing.ifPlural(Without those|Without that)~, you'll be much better off. Too many trinkets will only keep you down.
How long do you think you'll last?
Like a leaf, flowing in the wind, soon to be lost.
You kept your cards close and kept the advantage. I should be impressed, right?
Well, every little helps.
Careful, now. If you lose a third time in a row, you may need to bare more than you bargained for.
But we mustn't be careless!
I have no time for such small things!
Is that the best you can muster?
Still, things could yet be worse.
Hardly doing me any favors, but I don't blame you for this situation.
Something else will need to be my focus for now...
Even something small can have value in a pinch.
Keep a close inventory of your belongings before continuing on a journey.
Not bad, but don't get careless!
I can see why you'd keep ~clothing.ifPlural(those|that)~ at hand.
Keep moving forwards!
Stay focused, stay sharp.
~clothing.ifPlural(Those were|That was)~ only holding you back, anyway.
You're already showing plenty, so this is no bother.
No reason for me to complain. You're already showing off plenty.
You aren't just stalling at this point, are you?
Hm. Not very inspiring in this moment, I will admit.
I think you can count yourself lucky.
Can you do without ~clothing.ifPlural(those|it)~? Double check, to be sure.
Start slow, then speed up when things get dicey.
Quick as you like!
~clothing.ifPlural(Without those|Without that)~, you'll be much better off. Too many trinkets will only keep you down.
How long do you think you'll last?
You kept your cards close and kept the advantage. I should be impressed, right?
Well, every little helps.
What's this? A Mechon krabble? Did you create that yourself, Rita?
...If Nadia wasn't fine, she wouldn't be talking about this so casually. Everybody stay calm.
